intro: Hieracium sublesianum, commonly known as the Sublesian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often reddish in color. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium sublesianum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread vegetatively through rhizomes.
